search_input: Not everyone might try to enter a labyrinth or return unharmed from one; to enter it was equivalent to an initiation. The “centre” might be one of a variety of things.
suggested_query: As I stood there, the steam swirling around me, I felt the weight of the labyrinth's presence, the silence of the centre, and the echoes of the road leading back to the place of rest. The whiteness seemed to seep into my pores, erasing the lines of my face, and I knew that I was being drawn towards something I could not quite see, a place that was both familiar and unknown. The train rumbled on, a distant hum, as I felt myself being pulled towards the centre, towards the heart of the labyrinth.
suggest_context: One night when I went out to drink water from the garden tap, I heard a long-haul truck barreling along a distant freeway, and another time, as steam rose around my dishwater, I felt the floor rumble with a passing train. The total whiteness is an effacement, an obliterationa neutral element, like a road leading to a place of rest. It is as if one were in a cavern, hidden away, a place where one rediscovers ones origins and roots. They evoke the idea of a place beyond, a place to which one might aspire. They draw one towards a place that, ultimately, one is perhaps not allowed to enter. The centre might be one of a variety of things.
